data.title: Windows 7: title does not change when opening another one from File > Recent

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.6.1 (9e4e44c19e393803e2b05fe2323cf4ed7e36880e, 2016-10-13T16:21:53.542Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.1.7601
- Extensions: donjayamanne.python-0.5.0, liuji-jim.vue-0.1.3

Steps to Reproduce:

1.Open 'Folder_1' in code, and edit 'File_1'.
2.Open 'Folder_2' in File->Open Recent.
3.As the workspace finished loading, the window's title is still 'File_1 - Forder_1 - Visual Studio Code', rather than 'File_x - Folder_2 - Visual Studio Code'

data.title: Icon theme's highContrast associations not working
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1
- OS Version: Mac OS Sierra 10.12

Steps to Reproduce:
I've created an icon theme which includes icons for the HighContrast theme. https://github.com/jtlowe/vscode-icon-theme

Within the icon set file (/fileicons/vscode-icon-theme.json), I have the section "highContrast" with extensions associated to the icons. When using the High Contrast theme, the icons default to the light theme icons instead of the ones listed under the "highContrast" setting. 

I've looked at the theme documentation quite a bit and can't see anything I'm missing. Any suggestions.

Would it help to publish a new version of my theme to the marketplace?

data.title: Feature Suggestion: Allow using multiple tsconfig.jsons
data.body:
Hello, I have a possible feature suggestion.

In the project I am working on at work we currently have our main `tsconfig.json` which points the the entry point of our application `app.ts` and our main external typings folder (for custom typings not yet placed on DefinitelyTyped).

However we also use a tsconfig-tests.json which we use to run all of our tests which live beside our source files with the ending in `.test.ts`. In each file we have to use a reference to our custom typings eg. `../../../typings/index.d.ts`. It'd be wonderful to somehow allow configuring multiple tsconfigs based on file endings.

Thanks for your time!

data.title: Polish language support
data.body:
Please add Polish support and Polish keyboard key bindings (Polish keyboard does not use alt+[letter] for shortcuts as this conflicts with inputting letters like ążółćń).

I'd be happy to help with translations in case you are open to contributions via services like getlocalization.

data.title: VSCode is not honoring the order in which I return symbols
Property 'moduleName' is missing in type.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: master branch
- OS Version: Win7

Hi,

I checked out the master branch code and am playing around with the code. 

However I keep running into this same error for every class I create and add to the project when I try to use the IInstantiationService to create an instance of it.

The error is always the same but MY_TYPE is different and the X-number of the AsyncDescriptorX class (depending on the number of constructor arguments needed).

```
Error: Argument of type 'typeof MY_TYPE' is not assignable to parameter of type 'AsyncDescriptor0<>'.  Property 'moduleName' is missing in type 'typeof MY_TYPE'.
```

for code

```
const dataSource = this.instantiationService.createInstance(MY_TYPE);
```

Is there something non-obvious that I must do when creating new classes. This happens also when I create a new class that has the exact same implementation as an existing class in the project (just a different class-name and file-name).

Cleaning, building, restarting, etc do not work.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create any new class in the master branch
2. Use the `instantiationService.createInstance()` function to instantiate it

data.title: "it is recommended" is overly passive
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1
- OS Version: Linux

Time for a really petty bug report. Ready?

There are several locations where VS Code uses "it is recommended" without any context, and it just feels wrong. Specific examples:
- "It is recommended to keep the commit's first line under 50 characters" when typing a commit message > 50 char. **What** is recommending that? This could be reworded as:
  - "The Git style guide recommends the first line is under 50 characters."
- "It is recommended to install the 'someone.something' extension" when opening certain filetypes. **What** is recommending this and **why**? Plenty of replacements here; off the top of my head:
  - "You may want to install '{extension}' to edit this type of file."
  - "The extension '{extension}' may be useful in your project." -- still kind of vague, but removes the "it" that doesn't refer to anything
  - "This filetype can be handled by the '{extension}' extension in the Marketplace."

You can see more [in a search](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/search?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=%22it+is+recommended%22), though the two above are the main ones that are a little bothersome.

data.title: Add new cursor styles
data.body:
New styles:
- line (default)
- line-thin
- block
- block-outline
- underline
- underline-thin

Linked to Feature request: https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/1929

data.title: Intellisense not working at all
data.body: I'm really trying to give vscode a go, but after two days I'm unable to make intellisense work. I've tried configuring my project according to these instrustions: https://code.visualstudio.com/Docs/languages/javascript https://code.visualstudio.com/Docs/runtimes/nodejs I've completely uninstalled and re-installed both vscode and typings. I've tried removing the files argument from my jsconfig, as well as re-creating it completely. I've tried installing typings locally. I've also tried installing and running typescript from my machine instead of vscode's built-in typescript on the off chance that would help. No luck. If anyone could provide assistance I would greatly appreciate it. I'm running on OSX (or is is MacOS) Sierra with brew installed.

data.title: Format react-native code (.js files)
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1
- OS Version: macOS 10.12（16A323）

Steps to Reproduce:
1. react-native init SomeProject
2. code SomeProject
3. open index.ios.js
4. CMD+SHIFT+P
5. format (enter)

![out](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1487051/19628211/23f8b56c-998b-11e6-939a-4a5f2593d7f9.gif)

data.title: "ś" letter cannot be entered into Integrated Terminal
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 pro (10.0.14393 Build 14393)

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open Integrated Terminal (cmd.exe)
2. Paste any text containing letter "ś" to the terminal

Result:
String which appears in Integrated Terminal does not contain "ś" letters anymore. For example, trying to paste "---śśś---" results in "-----" appearing in the command line (notice one dash missing).

All other Polish letters work without issues (use "zażółć gęślą jaźń" for testing).

data.title: External Monitor - Editor - Dark theme has background patches
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.6.1 (9e4e44c19e393803e2b05fe2323cf4ed7e36880e, 2016-10-13T15:27:10.246Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.0.0
- Extensions: EditorConfig.EditorConfig-0.3.4, PasqNet.theme-earlytobed-0.0.4, PeterJausovec.vscode-docker-0.0.6, christian-kohler.path-intellisense-1.1.0, donjayamanne.githistory-0.1.0, eg2.tslint-0.5.39, formulahendry.terminal-0.0.5, gerane.Theme-TomorrowNight-0.0.2, lukehoban.Go-0.6.45, stevencl.addDocComments-0.0.8, xabikos.JavaScriptSnippets-1.2.0

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Select a dark theme for the editor, example "Early to Bed"
2. Move cursor on any lines in the editor
3. Notice the background color has patches of lighter shades.

See 
![vscodeissue](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/8013222/19627894/5be204fe-996f-11e6-976d-09df6ff2e4f1.gif)

Issue is noticed in any dark theme. It does not occur on lighter themes. I am not sure if this issue is macOS specific. Also, this is not an issue when VSCode is in the default MacBook Pro display.

data.title: KeybindingResolver#_addKeyPress: relax check for conflicting keys
[Feature Request] REST Client
data.body:
REST client (or HTTP client) supported in IDEA and other IDEs and editors.

How it work:

1) Enter url.
2) Select type (GET/POST/PUT/DELETE)
3) Add request data:
3.1) Click "Add parameter"
3.2) Add key
3.3) Add value
3.4) GOTO 3.1
4) Send http request
5) See response (may be different MIME-types)

Many developers need this REST client. REST client need for debug API and web-application without HTML interface.

data.title: Shift + Home doesn't select the text
data.body:
_Version: Current insider build
OS: Windows 10_

I'm using <kbd>Shift</kbd>+<kbd>Home</kbd> quite often in order to select everything left of the cursor and place it to the first column of the current line. The selections doesn't work this way with the current insider build. 
Selecting text using these shortcuts works perfectly:
<kbd>Shift</kbd>+<kbd>↑</kbd> 
<kbd>Shift</kbd>+<kbd>↓</kbd> 
<kbd>Shift</kbd>+<kbd>→</kbd> 
<kbd>Shift</kbd>+<kbd>←</kbd> 
<kbd>Shift</kbd>+<kbd>End</kbd>

data.title: Document when ReferenceContext.includeDeclarations might be false
data.body:
I can't find in the documentation where `ReferenceContext.includeDeclaration` would be false. I don't see any user settings or language configuration that can affect this and it is always `true` in my tests.

Documenting the behavior of this would be nice.

data.title: Improve folder colors when using Ubuntu bash on Windows 10
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 Pro 1607

I have configured Ubuntu bash to use as integrated terminal in VS Code.
I've noticed it that folders are marked differently from files, as if they are highlighted (selected) with green background but the font color is also some kind of green/blue shade. It is very hard to distinguish what is the name of the folder. 
Same goes for dark or light themes.

data.title: Lightbulb always brings error: "Running the contributed command:'_internal_command_delegation' failed""

I'm on a Windows 10 machine
